b26.title: Contact inhibition of locomotion in vivo controls neural crest directional migration
b26.reason: Provides the first demonstration of cells undergoing CIL in vivo and shows that RHOA and PCP signalling are involved

b27.title: Inter-Cellular Forces Orchestrate Contact Inhibition of Locomotion
b27.reason: Shows that precisely orchestrated repulsion is required for CIL to work as a patterning cue

b43.title: Competition amongst Eph receptors regulates contact inhibition of locomotion and invasiveness in prostate cancer cells
b43.reason: Shows how signalling through distinct Eph receptors controls heterotypic CIL between cancer cells and normal cells to control their invasiveness

b51.title: Collective Chemotaxis Requires Contact-Dependent Cell Polarity
b51.reason: Shows how integrating CIL and chemotaxis responses can control the collective migration of a cell population
